metadata.intent: Establish master definition for character 'MIKE CHRISTIAN'
metadata.rationale: Extracted from canonical script and scene co-occurrence data.

data.description: Mike Christian is a tall, sweet, even-tempered broker in his 30s working at Bel Inc. He is one of the more grounded and socially aware members of the broker group, serving as an informal interpreter and mediator. While he participates in the crude office culture, he does so with more restraint and self-awareness than his peers, often acting as a bridge between the chaotic environment and newcomers like Dante.
data.dialogue_summary: Mike Christian's dialogue spans two main contexts: the pit introduction and the VIP booth gathering. In the pit, he joins the chaotic welcome for Dante with an exaggerated sexual outburst. In the booth, he is more measured â€” pressing Dante for Abe's secret, volunteering his own crude self-disclosure ('9 inches'), and repeatedly serving as a cultural interpreter for Joaquin's Newfoundland dialect and the firm's unspoken norms. His speech patterns are direct, confident, and occasionally conspiratorial, positioning himself as a knowledgeable insider and ally.

explicit_evidence.source_scene: INT. PRIVATE VIP ROOM - GIANT BOOTH - 5PM

explicit_evidence.quote: Yah, good point Mike. No secrets in this firm. Not wise to get off to a bad start with us. We're your allies. Management will just use you to get what they want. We are the ones who support each other.
explicit_evidence.source_scene: INT. PRIVATE VIP ROOM - GIANT BOOTH - 5PM

explicit_evidence.quote: No secrets between us, right? 9 inches.
explicit_evidence.source_scene: INT. PRIVATE VIP ROOM - GIANT BOOTH - 5PM

explicit_evidence.quote: He means, who are your parents?
explicit_evidence.source_scene: INT. PRIVATE VIP ROOM - GIANT BOOTH - 5PM

explicit_evidence.quote: Don't worry, he doesn't always talk like this. His Newfie always comes out when he drinks... or when it's showtime.
explicit_evidence.source_scene: INT. PRIVATE VIP ROOM - GIANT BOOTH - 5PM

explicit_evidence.quote: YES. YESSSSS!!!! I LOVE YOU DANTE!!!!!!!!!!!!!! YES!!!!!!!!!!!
explicit_evidence.source_scene: INT. BEL INC. CORRIDOR - RIGHT OF THE PIT (CONTINUOUS)

inferred_traits.rationale: Mike Christian consistently acts as a translator and contextualizer for Dante, explaining Joaquin's dialect and the firm's unspoken rules, suggesting he reads social situations well.
His speech about 'no secrets' and 'management will just use you' reveals a clear us-vs-them mentality that prioritizes broker solidarity.
inferred_traits.trait: loyalty to peer group over management

inferred_traits.rationale: While he participates in crude humor, his outbursts are less extreme than Mike the Shit's, and he tends to redirect or comment rather than escalate situations.
His unprompted '9 inches' comment delivered calmly and humorously suggests comfort with his own sexuality and a lack of defensiveness.
He takes time to explain firm culture and Joaquin's behavior to Dante, suggesting a mild protective or guiding interest in her integration.

data.name: MIKE CHRISTIAN

relationships.evidence: Explains firm culture to her, presses her for secrets, makes sexual self-disclosure, and positions himself as her ally against management.
They banter, trade punches, and egg each other on; Mike Christian comments on Mike the Shit's behavior to Dante as a warning.
He interprets Joaquin's dialect for Dante and receives a warm acknowledgment ('Spot on, buddy') from Joaquin.
Seated together in the booth, Mike Christian takes the champagne bottle from Dunaway when he struggles with the cork.
Present together in the booth during the celebration; part of the same broker cohort.

scene_presence: INT. BEL INC. CORRIDOR - RIGHT OF THE PIT (CONTINUOUS)
INT. PRIVATE VIP ROOM - GIANT BOOTH - 5PM
